summary: Running Skyrim below recommended specs? Find that it usually runs fine, but certain areas make your FPS just drop to a crawl? Have no fear! Check out this list of ini tweaks and mods to help boost your performance, without killing visuals too much. You can trust me. I run a potato. O.O
descriptionHtml:
[center][size=4]Lag is a pain. Especially when you're not running a computer made to deal with games like Skyrim, even if it's a little old now. But thankfully, the Skyrim modding community and others have figured out many ways to reduce this issue as much as possible. I am aware that there are many lists like this already, but I thought I might make my own. Besides, you may find some mods and tricks that you've never heard of on here.

[size=5][b]~ INI ~[/b][/size]
First, we'll start with tweaking your INI settings. These have to do with... Well, pretty much everything in Skyrim, from LOD (level of detail) distance, to water, to bandits taunting at you. You can customize this by editing the Skyrim.ini and Skyrimprefs.ini files in Documents/My Games/Skyrim/ with a program like Notepad (make sure it runs as administrator), a utility called [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/69787/]BethINI, [/url][/size][size=3][size=4]or using the Configurator or INI editor within [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1334/]Mod Organizer[/url]﻿.[/size][size=5][color=#cc0000][b]
*** Make sure to backup your INI files before editing ***[/b][/color][/size]
[size=6][b][color=#741b47]//Skyrim.ini//[/color][/b][/size]

[size=5][b][Display][/b]
[b]iPresentInterval= 0 or 1[/b][/size]
[size=4][i]This setting lets you decide whether or not to cap your FPS at 60 to prevent
screen-tearing, lag, instability, and bugs with Havok physics.
- If your computer refresh rate is 60 (you should be able to see this in your graphics settings), type 1 for this value
- If you use another means of limiting framerate (like with ENBoost), then this needs to be left at 0[/i][/size]

[size=5][b] [Grass][/b][/size]
[size=3][b][size=5]iMinGrassSize= # (default: 20)[/size][/b][/size]
[size=4][i]This helps determine how dense (spread out) grass is.[/i]
[i]- If grass gives you FPS problems and/or you use flora mods, try raising
this value to 40, 60, 80, or 100 for a good FPS boost. I use a value of
100 for a decent balance between visuals and performance.[/i]
[color=#741b47][i][color=#990000]Warning: High values (such as 10000), can lead to CTDs.[/color][/i][/color][/size]

[b][size=5]bAllowCreateGrass = 0[/size][/b]
[b][size=5]bDrawShaderGrass = 0
bGrassPointLighting = 0[/size][/b]
[size=4][i]These settings determine whether or not grass (or flowers from flora mods) will appear. This doesn't affect alchemy plants. Setting it to 0 will disable it. [/i][/size]
[b]
[size=5]fGrassWindMagnitudeMax = 0
fGrassWindMagnitudeMin = 0[/size][/b]
[size=4][i]These settings determine whether or not plants will sway in the wind. Disabling it may add a potential performance boost.[/i][/size]

[b][size=5]iMaxGrassTypesPerTexure = 5 (this is the proper spelling)[/size][/b]
[i][size=4]This setting determines how many types of grass/flowers you can see. The default setting is 2. Flora mods may ask for higher values for a slight FPS reduction.[/size][/i]


[b][size=5] [LightingShader][/size][/b]
[b][size=5]fSpecularLODFadeEnd=# (default: 0.1000)[/size][/b]
[b][size=5]fSpecularLODFadeStart=# (default: 0.0900)[/size][/b]
[size=4][i]These settings help decide when specularity (shininess or wetness) of objects appear. I highly recommend you tweak this if you get lag when around NPCs, in caves, modded locations with lots of objects, and ESPECIALLY IN THE RAGGED FLAGON.[/i]
[i]- To disable specularity altogether, set both of these values to 0.0[/i]
[i]- Alternatively, you can just reduce these values [/i][/size][size=5][i][size=4]greatly to [/size][color=#741b47][color=#ffffff][size=4]0.0025, 0.0004, etc. [/size][/color]
[/color][/i][/size]
[b][size=5][Trees]
bEnableTreeAnimations = 0
fUpdateBudget = 0[/size][/b]
[i]These determine whether or not trees sway in the wind. You can set these to 0 for a potential slight FPS increase.[/i]
[size=5][b]
[Water]
bReflectLODLand = 0
bReflectLODObjects = 0
bReflectLODTrees = 0
bReflectSky = 0[/b][/size]
[i]Determines what water reflects. I disable them all and just enjoy the shininess of it.[/i][color=#351c75][size=6][color=#741b47][b]

//SkyrimPrefs.ini//[/b][/color][/size][/color]
[b][Display]
bFloatPointRenderTarget=0 or 1 (default=1)[/b]
[i]This setting controls accuracy of lighting and reflections.
- Set it to 0 for a slight to medium FPS boost[/i]
[color=#351c75][size=6][color=#741b47][size=5][color=#000000][color=#741b47][i][color=#990000]Warning: Setting it to 1 is required for ENB and certain mods.[/color][/i][/color][/color][/size][/color][/size][/color]

[b]bDrawLandShadows= 0 or 1 (default=0)[/b]
[i]This setting lets shadows be rendered on objects like rocks and mountains.
- Set it to 0 for a slight FPS boost[/i]
[size=5][color=#741b47][i][color=#990000]Warning: This is required for ENB and certain mods. [/color][/i][/color][/size]

[b]bShadowsonGrass=0 or 1 (default=1)[/b]
[i]This settings lets grass be rendered with shadows.
- Set it to 0 for a slight FPS boost
Warning: This is required for ENB[/i]

[b]bTreesReceiveShadows= 0 or 1 (default=0)[/b]
[i]This settings adds shadows to trees.
- Set it to 0 for a slight FPS boost[/i]
Warning: This is required for ENB

[b]bFull Screen=0 or 1[/b]
[i]This setting lets you play in windowed of full-screen mode.
- Set it to 1 if you crash or lag even more in windowed mode
- Set it to 0 if you can for a potential FPS boost
Note: These results depend on your computer[/i]

[b]iMaxAnisotropy=#[/b]
[i]This setting determines how well textures look from far away.
- Set to 0 for potential improvement in performance[/i]

[b][size=5]~Credits~[/size][/b]
[/size][size=4]A special thanks to all of the mod authors and Skyrim community members for sharing their tips and mods! If you found any of them helpful, make sure to endorse their mods or thumbs up! :)
